Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

-9JZVL4Jke9MiyOF8HqW7g.text: I visited here with a friend while in town.  The vibe was elevated trendy, it was comfortable but still felt nice.  I got the kale salad and the short ribs and both were delicious!  The ricotta in the kale salad was kind of smoky and the vinaigrette was light, it was really great.  Our server seemed a little less than enthused but still attentive and prompt. Would love to go back next time I'm in town!

czBzuIyQ1SjkCokGSHhw0A.text: The bar staff here are the best! The brunch options are very good and the Bloody Mary Bar is unmatched in Pittsburgh. Everything we ate or drank there was excellent. We had several meals here during our extended stay at the Monaco and enjoyed all of them. Very consistent service and food. This will be our new watering hole when we are in Pittsburgh.

0clzw_V3ML-hH_guP5941g.text: During a quick trip to Pittsburgh we went in search of dinner after a crazy travel day - so we really didn't want drama, but did want good eats.  And we found that at Commoner.  The space is really great.  Just below street level with a hip, speakeasy sort of vibe.  We were quickly told without reservations we were limited but we promised to eat quickly and we were seated immediately.  We were told the menu had recently changed - so we opted for a burger and the Turkey Confit Poutine.  Wow what a treat!  start with a glass of wine, and end with the house coffee, and we were thoroughly impressed.  Plus our waiter was a really nice fella and took amazing care of us!  Highly recommended!

NUEXL4jrqFs9xkzoPLBlnw.text: By far the worst service ever. We called in to get a late night table for 5 and the hostess on the phone was extremely rude. I chalked it off as phone thing. We arrive and she was just as rude while seating us. She threw our menus at the table. Our server never bothered to talk to us and never came back. For first time in my life I walked out after I have been seated. Very disappointed.

qzY-TtrmTkKB2oFCGpfL4Q.text: Brunch review- I had come to town for a couples get away weekend with the intention of exploring and indulging in lots of good food and drinks. We had wanted to go back to Meat and Potatos for the Bloody Mary bar brunch, but they were booked weeks in advance, which turned out to our benefit because we ended up at the Commoner instead. I had seen some friends posts with delicious looking cocktails so decided to check it out. We got in with no wait. I'm not personally a huge Blood Mary fan, although I do enjoy a Bloody Caesar, but even I was impressed with the Bloody Mary bar and their extensive option or mixes and toppings. The atmosphere was sort of industrial chic, with an open kitchen, it's a large space just below street level with sidewalk view windows. There is a large bar and plenty of seating, we sat at a table as a group of 8. We actually started out as a group of six around 10:30am on a Saturday, we had a few rounds of Craft cocktails/bloody Mary's that did not disappoint and likewise the food was great. It was actually so good that when the fourth couple who was coming later showed up around 1:30 we decided to stay for a second round of food and drinks from the midday menu. In a town that has a lot of great food options, anyplace that's good enough to convince my crew of foodies to stay for multiple meals in one day is a five star joint.

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

W936xEiasoixlwz0f2_i0g.text: High quality food and drinks! But, there are many restaurants out there exactly like this, with better prices. So it wouldn't be my first choice, but it's definitely a safe choice.

aq_X1mZZAMvKbalVsQAcTw.text: Stopped in on Saturday for lunch with my girlfriend around 2pm.  It was my first time visiting and she had recommended it based on a couple things - the interior is beautiful and the menu has interesting combinations, which seem to be enticing upon glancing through.     We immediately ordered coffee and when that was brought, we requested the sweet potato bisque to start. The best part of our meal was this dish - it was really the only redeeming quality of our experience at The Commoner. Honestly, we did not see much of our waitress during the meal. Since we have both worked as servers, we chalked this up to having something to do with the slow time between lunch and dinner. But, we specifically said we were almost ready to order the meal as we placed the soup order - and only needed a minute. We did not see her again until about 10 minutes later when our soup was finished.  Eager to order our food, we requested a medium rare steak and the cauliflower -shouldn't take long right?     Wrong again - we waited almost 25 minutes for that food to come out.  In last 5 minutes of that time frame, we watched our $28 steak die under heat lamps (restaurant kitchen is open concept/in plain view) - while it waited for the crispy (real talk -- fried) cauliflower.  Confused about the kitchen and waitstaff logic at this point.  Still - after the undesired wait - we ate the luke warm and overcooked steak. The menu listed pomme frites + foie gras butter + petite salad.  We were not expecting frozen out of a bag cheap french fries with 2 sprigs of spider lettuce thrown on top. I would honestly have preferred Wendy's fries to these cheap frozen "frites".  The cauliflower was pretty good but, the experience had been soured by the wait time and the terrible excuse for $28 lunch steak that was presented to us.    The one mistake I made in the experience was not saying something when the waitress asked how the meal was.  I simply replied "good" and asked for the check-  I am always hesitant to complain when being served. I do not like to leave bad reviews because it can seem unfair based on ONE experience-  However, at this point my girlfriend and I are waiting again- for the check.  Discussing how let down we were with the whole thing- Then it all came together when she admitted that she was afraid this might happen---Confessing her TWO prior experiences here had terrible service encounters. She was a waitress at the time and assumed it was just poor luck.    Bottom line: Third time's a charm. This establishment is missing a lot of crucial parts to charge the $$$ for the experience they are pretending to create.

i2IR1VH5aL6owjGYwzBSoQ.text: Terrific place, especially if you are a hotel guest.  I made online reservations on the way to the hotel via Open Table.  Place was hopping!  We got prompt service, that remained pleasingly attentive.  Decent drink offerings - husband loved the specialty Clementine cocktail.  I had salmon with forbidden rice and spinach...salmon was perfect, with a delightful crisp skin, spinach was a wee bit salty and rice was a wee bit...something...not entirely recognizable as rice, but not unpleasant to eat, either.  Had prosecco and was happy.  Husband had a good burger, juicy and tasty with nicely seasoned fries.  Kids both had crab soup and ate every bite...loved it!  Pasta bolognese was devoured, as was the buffalo cottage pie.  He really loved the potatoes on top too!    We were too full for dessert, so we passed.  A lovely dining experience, especially welcome after a long travel day!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

m5KnN1G2d4wkDM8OJFvDng.text: Exceeded standards for a more than reasonable price, hardest thing was finishing the food and choosing what to eat

hUIm4SSlI9b5zEoyx46m-A.text: Absolutely hungry after a hard days work, I looked up for restaurants nearby and the menu at Commoner seamed appealing. A colleague of mine told me that the "evil smoosh" beer was the best he had ever had and I did not want to miss the opportunity to try it.  Well, the ambience was nice and I loved the decor. Felt the service was just ok. The waitress was very attentive and courteous, but I guess she had too many tables to handle, but all reasons for being hangry doze off if the food is good! I ordered brussel sprouts for appetizer and half chicken as entree. To my dismay both the dishes were disappointing. Brussel sprouts were a little soggy and the half chicken just had no taste. Probably am not going to that place again for a considerable amount of time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

qNETxzjaiOoc2Px4SnxOag.text: Great ambience, solid food, friendly staff. The menu is somewhat limited, but still has options for a variety of tastes. Good spot for brunch, dinner, or just a drink.

4fFBbZDxXHZvuJlU5kJ4gA.text: Came here for Sunday brunch, nice atmosphere and with no reservations got seated quickly  We got the yinz need breakfast and fried chicken sandwich   Yinz breakfast: this was a pretty basic dish but didn't impress, toast was dry, potatoes were bland - could have used more seasoning, sausage was okay, a little sweeter than what I would have wanted  Fried chicken sandwich: not great, chicken was very dry, should have had a better sauce, excess mayo, I scraped off a decent amount, asked for sriracha (which they have) and mixed together, added some much needed flavor, fries were just average  Overall, probably wouldn't return, unless you didn't make reservations and need something quick

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried chicken sandwich

1BP0Bti3yKzxibSWNAbdXQ.text: I purposefully didn't read the reviews beforehand so my experience could be completely unbiased. There is quite a buzz about this place among friends and colleagues but once I went -- and then read through the reviews -- ugh, I have to side with the majority of the reviews.   Ambience  5 Drinks        5 Service   3.5  Price          2 Food       N/A  My gf and I met for drinks after work on a Thursday. No happy hour specials. Bummer.  Three bartenders with 3/4 of the bar full and it took entirely too long for someone to approach us. Throughout our time there, two of the bartenders seemed aloof and not very personable. The female was the nicest and most attentive. She accidentally squirted beer all over me when a tap went out. Instead of getting me a napkin right away she sat there and cleaned off a glass and chatted with another worker. We had to ask a second time. But she did end up rectifying it later on at the end of evening so that's why service got the extra 1/2 point.   I was hungry but after reviewing the menu and the prices I opted to wait until I got home to eat. Not many options that appealed to me for one. And I realize we are in a nice hotel downtown but $17 bucks for a plate of cheese? The average price for a "nibble" was $17.   The drinks were the best part of the night for me. Although they forgot the garnishments on my friends' drink and we couldn't get their attention for so long she just said forget it. I got the Fortunato cocktail and it was absolutely delicious.  Milargro Blanco Tequila, Lime, Cherry heering, Lustau Amontillado Sherry, Cream Soda $13  I also got the Green Flash Passion Fruit Kicker (wheat ale)... fruity, refreshing, so flavorful I need to find out where I can get a case of this.   All in all, there are so many other establishments with good cocktails that have happy hour specials that I probably won't be going back here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Fortunato

CaFsXGiQ6FnKIQvi1J-RBA.text: I had very high hopes for their brunch and Bloody Mary bar but I have mixed feelings about it. While I loved my entree, I wasn't super thrilled with the Bloody Mary bar. I absolutely love the fact they offer bottle service for the bloody Mary's. This is one thing that does make the commoner brunch stand out from the rest. At $15 a piece for one Bloody Mary why not spend $58 on a bottle of grey goose and enjoy multiple. My friend and I made a total of 5 and had enough vodka leftover to make at least 1 if not 2 more.   As for the Bloody Mary bar itself, I didn't like it as much as some others I've tried. It's definitely nice that they have multiple tomato juice options such as original, smoked, and verde. However, I was not impressed with any of the 3 I tried. The toppings were definitely unique and they had a wide variety of hot sauces and spices to mix in.  The best part of my brunch was by far the entree. I got the pierogies and eggs. The day I went they were serving chorizo stuffed pierogies topped with poached eggs and verde sauce with a side of potatoes. Everything about this entree was spot on. The chorizo was no too spicy like some other chorizos that I don't like. The pierogies had more of a deep fried texture to them then a regular pierogi. The poached eggs were cooked perfectly and the verde sauce actually had flavor! Most places can't manage to make a good verde sauce but they did it.   This is one of those reviews where I wish we could give half star ratings. While I think a 3 sells the brunch a little short, I think a 4 is a little too generous. Combining both my dinner experience (see former review) and my brunch experience I unfortunately have to give it only a 3 star.

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bottle service
Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bloody Mary
Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pierogies and eggs

65EOo3Y6rEpe9j3kq20gbg.text: Wanted breakfast and the Courtyard microwave food wasn't going to cut it.  My handy Yelp app said the Commoner was nearby and reviews looked good so off we went on a five minute walk on a cool April day. We soon discovered this is the restaurant attached to the boutique Hotel Monaco.   The waitress was great. Ordered coffee and ice water and they quickly appeared. I love it when they leave the pot of coffee on your table for refills. It was a tasty darker roast blend.   My lady ordered an egg white and veggie omelette. I ordered a Western PA omelette. A side of crispy bacon to share as well as a fresh OJ.   The verdict? The food was good. My lady loved her omelette. The lunch meat ham heavy omelette didn't cut it for me nor did the non fresh squeeze tasting OJ. The bacon was good. The toast not very toasted.potatoes were good.   The fact this cost top dollar is the reason I'm not cutting slack here. We don't mind paying for top notch food that is worth it. Call it three stars or okay. Expected more but it was a good place to eat. At least the food wasn't microwaved.

Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bacon
Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Western Pa Omelette - potatoes rocked

Mg6xgprXWwjWEtqOGJ6rOA.text: We went to The Commoner for dinner before our Foo Fighters concert in Pittsburgh and it was a great atmosphere and the food was delicious.  I had the commoner burger and it was the best burger I've had in a long time!  My boyfriend had the pork chop which I tasted and that was also amazing!  I would say prices are not cheap.  My burger was $18  but was definitely worth it to me!  Make a reservation if you want a table.  We sat at the chefs bar and got to watch them cook!  I thought that was pretty cool!  We didn't have a reservation for that.

B4AKJzYNFDu4E4tLqGlZew.text: Customer service, customer service, customer service... that should be your number 1 for running a restaurant. The hostess hardly said a word and was very rude. I got the chicken sausage and it was very undercooked. I brought this to our waiter's attention and he picked up my plate looked at it and said "looks normal to me" and sat the plate back down. Very neat location and I liked the atmosphere but don't any customer service.

RPUkZlP-hAkJcXWvflv6RQ.text: First stop of the week  and I was pleasantly surprised .  Quick and friendly service .  The food was delish .  The English muffin was my favorite part .  I could tell from the first bite that these were homemade..  great job :-)

ZqmaRMVje65LwY1N1p0ERw.text: The drinks here are soooooo good. The food is good too but the drinks are what stand out.

1k-HhHv-X0rIpLx52DhqpQ.text: The service was excellent starting with the hostess, Mira who warmly greeted us with a smile. The food was delicious and drinks were fantastic.

NDlE7eBgJfiK3cb5BMeFww.text: I'm in the midst of a Whole30 (extreme paleo for 30 days) and dining out can be a real challenge. Even things that seem compliant always end up having soy, dairy, or sugar. Not at the Commoner! I was able to assemble a delicious, compliant meal with minimal substitutions. Our waitress was super nice in answering all of my questions and made sure to get an accurate answer from the kitchen instead of guessing which was so appreciated.   The meal itself was amazing. I had the butter lettuce salad (no cheese, add steak, bearnaise instead of sherry vinaigrette). I want to recreate it at home it was so good.   Paleo/Whole30 tips: all their dressings are made with olive or canola oil (no soy) and the bearnaise and hollandaise are both made with clarified butter. The sausage has sugar but the cashews do not.

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Butter Lettuce Salad, no cheese, add steak. Side of béarnaise instead of aged sherry vinaigrette.

hG0X97gHNZOlK5ek7doccA.text: Sort of an weird review since we didn't actually stay for dinner but it was an unusual experience so I figured I'd review!  Met my husband for our anniversary dinner on Saturday night; we always do mussels to celebrate because that's what we had on our first date. We had had them here before  but didn't see them on the menu.  We asked our waitress Stephanie about the mussels and she said that  they weren't on the dinner menu right now, but sometimes they are served as a special. I guess they change the menu pretty frequently here.  Hubby and I decided to finish our cocktails and search for mussels somewhere else.  When we asked for the check, Stephanie returned and asked if we were leaving because of the mussels and I explained that it was our anniversary and mussels are kind of our thing for our anniversary.    She immediately recommended a restaurant close by that she said had great ones, and even came back with the restaurant name and address written down for us!  I thought this was so nice, as we only got two drinks and took a while and then didn't even eat. Definitely left a good impression and made me want to come back another night.  But put the mussels back on the menu! They were SO good. Also the beer list is great, I definitely would come back for that since I had a cocktail this time! Ask for a corner booth, they were taken so we couldn't sit there but they're definitely the best for a romantic date night!!

Ru8yO7BqeeyrlXx3WEJB-Q.text: I liked it here, but I would never spend my money here on food again.  Drinks - maybe, if all other options were exhausted.  I had brunch with my girlfriends here this past Saturday and while the atmosphere and company I was with were great, that's about the extent of my great experience.  Our waitress was nice, but not super polite.  Seemed overwhelmed/annoyed by our group of 6.  Our drinks were OK. Waitress seemed to be pushing $11 glasses of Bellinis on us.  With the garnish in the flute taking up most of the room, I could've finished it in one gulp. It was just OK. I had a bloody mary with the pickle infused vodka.  Also just OK. Drinks took absolutely forever to come out. We were one of just a few other parties there, and I would hate to see it on a busy day or night.  Around the table, we ordered the burgers, crab cake Benedict, pierogis and eggs and I had the Western PA omelette that came with potatoes.  No complaints about any meals, but they, again, were just OK.  At $18 for an omelette, I would expect something slightly more than what I believe were frozen potatoes. They were not seasoned.  I have had far better omelettes and potatoes at Pamelas or.....Eat n Park to be honest.  Presentation was boring which was also disappointing given the trendy atmosphere  It was fine, but that's about as good as I'll give it.  For nearly a $50 tab just for myself having two drinks and an average meal, I didn't find it worth it. Couldn't even get a pretty food picture out of it.  Again, if I were having drinks before or after a dinner reservation elsewhere, I might have different thoughts because it seems they have interesting/fun cocktails and an extensive bar menu, but the food and experience for brunch missed the mark for me.

GcftWFIYFuALk0yflq0xhA.text: Came for a Saturday morning breakfast after wanting to try it for so long. I was pleasantly surprised by my experience! I had heard great things and it definitely lived up to expectations. The space is beautiful and very large, the staff was friendly and attentive, and the food was tasty! It seems like a place you could go for a date or with a large group of friends.   Everyone I was with had a good size portion of food and seemed to enjoy what they got. There were a few dishes I was debating but I opted for the "Uncommon Toast" which was very good. I can see where people think its pricey but I nonetheless enjoyed my time here. I will return to try dinner and/or drinks some time soon!

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Uncommon Toast

HgohKUIUcXaWHix7d-deSg.text: Amazing meal in downtown Pittsburgh.  This was our "fancy" night of the trip so we dressed up and made a reservation.  The restaurant is attached to a hotel, but you can enter from the hotel side or the street side. It kind of has an under ground feeling because you right below street level. Dark decor and fancy lighting make this restaurant very romantic.  I ordered a glass of white wine to start and my boyfriend ordered a beer. They have a great wine and beer list and some fancy cocktails too.  For dinner I ordered the tikka masala with tofu and my boyfriend ordered lobster pasta. We also got herb fries to share and a lemon berry cake for dessert. Fantastic meal and fantastic service!  After we finished our meal we headed over to the bar to have a couple more drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dessert!
Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tikka Masala with tofu
Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

qZh5PzuDKZFGpU-rjnlI2w.text: Nice lunch spot. Cool ambiance. Our server, Frank, was very nice and attentive.  A very diverse menu of offerings from Indian to classic American foods. I had the brocolli soup and the Fried Chicken Sandwich. I can't say that $12 for the brocolli soup was worth it, it wasn't anything mind blowing. The fried chicken sandwich was ok - dry and there wasn't really anything that stuck out about the batter/friedness of it. Boring in flavor.   All of the others that I dined with enjoyed their meals - the salmon and the sweet potato indian dish were hits!

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried Chicken Sandwich
Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salmon
Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Broccoli soup

7iwVDxBBr_MxR_73mcDWWw.text: Solid dinner and drinks. We got the flatbread, a caesar + proteins, the sticky toffee pudding and drinks - all very good. The flatbread wasn't amazing but solid. The caesar was very good, although be mindful that the salad+shrimp or salmon is $22, which isnt cheap. The salmon was fantastic but my husband got the shrimp and it only included 4 shrimp. Also both were missing croutons :( The sticky toffee pudding was INCREDIBLE. So moist and lovely. We got the manhattan and old fashioned drinks, both solid.  All in all, a good dinner spot, and the bill was $106 without tip.

ox-lI4fzZJXslQcB8zsJ6Q.text: I'd rate the commoner four and a half star.  Awesome spot for drinks. Great selection of craft beers and large whiskey selection. Super list of craft cocktails too. I had a beer and a couple whiskies from Wigle Distillery. My fiancee had one of their signature cocktails. She didn't like it so the bartender kindly offered to make her something different.  The service was very attentive and quick. Great restrooms and they're open until 2 am on Fridays.

vsC3S6CyOLNbmAsvAZP1jQ.text: We waited a long time for our breakfast. The woman sitting next to us was seated after us and had already finished before our food arrived. Nevertheless, the breakfast was very good. Would recommend trying this place for breakfast. Cheers.

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Two eggs scrambled. Yinzer breakfast.

ShVazTDvwgki_jXZ8CxYgA.text: I was here last weekend with my boyfriend and another friend. We booked a table for Friday night dinner. Our experience was decidedly less frustrating than last time, hence the updated rating. Our server was attentive, looking into my entree being made dairy-free, and recommended some excellent cocktails from the list. I went with their high-end take on the cosmo (not my usual drink by any means) and was taken aback by how much I enjoyed it.   I ate the burger again and it was even better than last time. My boyfriend had the lobster Bolognese and loved it, minus the odd addition of green peas. When he mentioned that in passing to a manager, he was given another serving to-go, sans peas! It's those details that make you want to come back to a place. I'll gladly add The Commoner to our favorite downtown restaurants rotation after this last visit. Next time we may come in for brunch!

vJc1MNPlUWbvEziR9xMQ7g.text: Everything was wonderful! The bar staff was so nice and helpful when I was trying to figure out what I wanted for brunch. The drink (Subtropical Daiquiri) was so pretty and refreshing! The Crab Benedict was amazing!! I was to sure about hollandaise but it added to the complexity of the dish and was really good. I would definitely recommend!!! P.s. the bathroom was beautiful and clean

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bloody Mary Bar and Subtropical Daiquiri

dEoPNBspSgzN1Hx1gG_H_g.text: I'm so glad I stumbled upon this breakfast spot! This was by far the best way to end my Pittsburgh trip. I had ordered a pierogi dish that was phenomenal (I'm Polish -- So this says a lot being that I eat homemade pierogis on the regular). I would definitely recommend everyone to pop in if you're in the area.   Hard to locate from outside. It is inside the hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pierogi and Eggs

bwE0nz7yFZk7FUamypLr1Q.text: We stopped in to grab a drink and little bite to eat, before heading upstairs to get ready for dinner. We luckily grabbed two seats at the bar and were served by a wonderful bartender. My mom had a Grey Goose Cosmo and I had the Mixing Vodka and Emotions (on the recommendation of the bartender!). The drinks were wonderfully prepared and mine was absolutely delicious. The best part about the Mixing Vodka and Emotions was the matcha ice cube, as it melts it turns the drink slightly creamy!   We decided to order a little charcuterie cone and some potato chips. The order came out quickly and was lovely! The mustard sauce was delicious.   Definitely worth a stop-in for a delicious craft cocktail and a bite to eat! So happy this is conveniently located in The Monaco!

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Potato Chips
Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Charcuterie Cone
Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

OqL2BExzV_0u9TZHk8oIcw.text: The only reason I went to the  restaurant was because of all the cool drinks you advertised on Instagram. I ordered a $16 drink and that was NOT what a "cool drink" would look like. For the price you charge I should AT LEAST get my drink in a glass instead of a plastic cup.  Regarding the food, I got this pork that was very spicy and it wasn't clear in the menu such thing. I couldn't eat a single bite of it - I can't eat spicy food!  I'm overall disappointed with my experience

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy pork..... the menu did not say spicy and I couldn&#39;t eat
Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Not what I expected to be a &#34;cool&#34; drink. Disappointed. I came here for the nice drinks and I got this plastic cup!!

DM6XzeqC3Pi_ZjNMgx6ExQ.text: Wonderful breakfast find on a Sunday morning in downtown Pittsburgh. They have a Bloody Mary bar that was a big hit! The food was creative and delicious. Staff very friendly and unobtrusive but vigilant. I will come back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dining area

IH8NbteexgvWFRDyTdTp5A.text: In Pittsburg for the weekend! We needed to make a quick brunch reservation for 4 and this place kept popping up. I called around 11 and they had a 12pm open with no additional wait. Sweet.  Got there and there was tons of space. Nice atmosphere and pleasant staff as well. We had the chicken & waffles, French toast, burger, and crab Benedict. All were excellent! The burger was on the average side but good nonetheless.   Everything is a bit on the pricey side but all the portions were the perfect size. The French toast was heavy so I wouldn't recommend eating it alone, it's good to share. The crab Benedict was delicious. It had just the right amount of crab!   I would recommend! Def not the best spot if you're on a budget! Lattes are 6 bucks!

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab Benedict ($18)
Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken &amp; waffles ($18)

1i4Fq8hlCQ7E5-u945MieQ.text: Tonight we had a fantastic meal at "The Commoner" here in Pittsburgh, PA! I can with full honestly say this meal was far from common. The atmosphere was that of a modern golden age with a bit of a speakeasy feel. While i cannot brag about everything we enjoyed tonight, here are a few things I recommend you try; The Butter Lettuce salad with radicchio, grape, pear, cashew, blue cheese an aged sherry vinaigrette with marinated pan seared tofu. I know you are thinking,  really, a salad... but his particular salad had so much flavor and it was big enough to be your whole meal. Everything was so fresh and crisp each ingredient elevating the others as they danced on my pallet. By far this was one of the best salads i have had in a long time.  Next I had the Milk & Honey Pork Belly which was listed as an appetizer but I ordered this as my entree and it did not disappoint.  A nice chunk of pork belly that has been braised in milk and then had the cap seared and glazed with honey that makes for a perfectly crisp and toothsome bite.  This is  the perfect balance of sweet and savory pork longs for.  The meat beneath was perfectly tender and moist ready to lovingly caress the creamy smoked cheddar grits and rich pan sauce that surrounded it.    I would go back and have these things again tomorrow but there is so much more to explore here. My friends also had several other tasty treats that I shamelessly requested they snap photos of. If you are ever in Pittsburgh i recommend you stop in.

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tikka Masala
Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Angry Lobster Bolognese
Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Strip Steak

5aXl5AyW79JCSp1VkwRTkg.text: This was my second visit to the Commoner and I don't know why I didn't write a review the last time because this place is awesome. I loved this place the first time on my first visit to Pittsburgh last year, so much so that on my second visit I had to make sure we stopped in for a proper breakfast. This place did not disappoint.   I had the Yinz Need Breakfast which came with a "homemade" English muffin which was fresh and warm like it had just come out of the oven. The scrambled eggs were fluffy and creamy just the way that I liked it, and my meal came with enough bacon to feed a family of four. My meal came with so much food that despite being stuffed, I had enough food to take home and have later for second breakfast.  My brunch companion was French and a quiche connoisseur and had only high praise for the ham, cheddar and chive quiche which she said was velvety, creamy and delicious. We also ordered the fruit salad as  bonus plate to share. While we enjoyed the medley of melon, strawberry, cantaloupe, blackberries and blueberries, the ricotta under the fruit seemed a little out of place, ...  I would have preferred just a plain greek yogurt.   We did not order drinks this time around but on my last visit I tried the Bloody Mary bar which was incredible.   If in downtown Pittsburgh be sure to stop by and try this place out, you will not be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yinz   Need Breakfast
Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beautiful light fixtures

b6e9n90C_H6veKmbWbrWqA.text: Oooooomg! Love it here! I've been here for dinner/just drinks before, but never for brunch. It was INCREDIBLE! Honestly, yes, it is a little more on the pricey side... however, for the price you get a good sized brunch. I had the pierogi and eggs, it was simply divine. My friend had the salmon, and loved it! They also have really good immunity/health "shots" as well as incredible cold brew coffee! I will most certainly be back as I was instantly hooked after just one bite. I'd also suggest looking at the drink menu if you're in the mood for something outrageous and unlike any other bar in Pittsburgh. Can't wait to go again.  ____________________________________________________________ Update, I AM IN LOVE with this place... not even just love anymore! I am now gluten and dairy free and they made me a lamb burger on gluten free bread and made sure my meal was gluten free. Wow are they amazing here! Also, the lamb burger is amazing in general. So good and cooked so well. I love knowing there's a place in Pittsburgh THIS GOOD.

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

pmOnKp7U_dCoMmLpHypqJQ.text: I stopped in to the commoner for breakfast with a colleague. The nitro brewed coffee was very good and it felt like I was ordering from a coffee house. The egg white frittata was delicious and the fruit on the side was just as appetizing. The service was really great from the multiple people we interacted with. What was wonderful were the high top tables in the middle  or I should say the high top bar has power outlets at every seat so it made working and eating very easy I really enjoyed going to this location and will absolutely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

fiMAIR8KJJgFwDJkPHt0Jw.text: Go early. At lunchtime this place fills up, as it's really rather delicious and somehow affordable in downtown Pgh! I'll definitely be back for more of my tomato bisque soup and grilled cheese!

wro1iQj5oVj7s-RzmjmYmw.text: Very cute atmosphere and friendly service. Great for groups of any size and they take reservations via Open Table.  We came for brunch and i would have to say i loved the atmosphere and vibe but the food was very mediocre and tasted like it was frozen or previously pre-packaged. Nothing was actually hot it was more warm or room temperature. I tasted the shrimp and grits and the shrimp was delicious but they only gave you 4 small pieces, the grits were room temperature.  The crab Benedict was okay, the poached eggs were done nicely, and they weren't bad, but the potatoes tasted mediocre and were cold.    They did have a pretty cool looking Bloody Mary bar. We had their regular bloody extra spicy and a mimosa and those beverages were delicious.

p6ZqgbYzqDjUSUxhyJ3uZw.text: This review is a little all over the place. Ok, #1 reason we stopped here was to check out the buddy the elf pop up par that was advertised on yelp. The fact that the pop up bar was awful really started our night on the wrong foot. My friend and I stood in line for about 40 minutes to get to the front of the line. Once we were in the pop up bar it was extremely disappointing. Yes, the names of the drinks were cute and clever but they were all pre mixed, and about 2 ounces for $10. We got a drink; and quickly left. We weren't impressed with that at all.    Dinner! We walked downstairs and were pleasantly surprised the wait on a Friday night was only about ten minutes. We got to sit at the chefs table which was super awesome, we were able to see where the food was prepared. It was super clean and all of the chefs seemed super laid back even though they were slammed with orders.   I ordered the catch of the day, and it was good! A little fishy for me, but it was my first time having that type of fish. My friend got the lamb burger and said it was a-ok, she ended up getting bacon and egg when she didn't ask for it but I guess it was just "too much". Our favorite part was the scotch eggs! I do highly recommend them. They were made with duck, rather than pork. They are also in a curry paste! Yum!  Finally, our server (sigh) had the worst attitude from the second she walked up to us that night. She read Off the specials so fast and when I asked her to please repeat what she had said (for both specials) you would have thought I asked her for $1,000. We felt rushed, and u attended to.  Would come back for brunch, but not for dinner again. There are tons of restaurants just like this in the city.

photos.caption: Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Commoner - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chefs table

co4tbuME9r21dW7n4en7mg.text: I just went to The Commoner for the first for dinner last night and it was a wonderful experience. I had made a reservation and we were promptly seated by a friendly host. Our waiter was very attentive and our food came out incredibly quickly (I caveat this statement with the information that we were there at 5:15pm, just after it opened for dinner). There was a Pens game at Consol that night and our waiter asked if we were going to make sure we were out on time if we were going. The food was really excellent. I especially loved the "to share" asparagus with poached egg plate. I was pleasantly surprised to find the high attention to detail at the restaurant, which manifested itself when I was brought curry powder and chili oil fresnos for my Tikki Masala when I asked for additional spiciness and the way in which my leftovers were boxed, with plastic laid down at the bottom of the paper box to prevent leaking and herbs carefully sprinkled on top. My only disappointment is the lack of vegetarian options on the menu, but they were very accommodating and made a flatbread without the meat for my sister. The prices are on the higher side, but worth it for the quality of food you are getting. I will definitely be going back!

HGi0UjrmtMNbjAEVsgK42g.text: Great rooftop but drinks are a lite pricey. A great place for a group as their are tons of giant board games to play for free.

Rc8qdVKmcbtAr_6S1QwxZg.text: Solid food and good ambience. They could do with having a few more local beers on tap, but other than that, nice place.

XcP3SrOckHnIV-kIxKZzlQ.text: Hey Pittsburgh, keep an open mind and check this place out. I think the Commoner offers an outstanding food experience you must try. (maybe before a game?) ~Cheddar Board: cheese selections were terrific. Then add in that apple butter and dried fruit and bread and O.M.G.  We were arguing over who got the last pieces. :)  ~Onion Soup: we ordered it 2 nights in a row. a little salty, but good. ~Steak & Ale Pie: Hellz yes. That was seriously delicious. **Yep, it's super loud in there. Ask the hostess to put you in the back of the restaurant, much, much better. But if you can't hear each other, so what? Take in the really awesome design of the room. (with the steel girders echoing the heritage of Pgh) and the staff's uniforms (which i LOVED). If you have time,  GO UPSTAIRS and dig on the biergarten; it must be terrific because we were guests of the hotel and we still had to get on a wait list.  Overall, If I still lived in Pittsburgh, this would definitely be my pre-game or post-game spot. Loved it!

BLwsNr6OVhdMo0xP8dIyyA.text: The food and drinks were really good, try the shrubble, it's awesome.  My main deterrent for 4 stars vs. 3 was our server, though he was a nice guy, the wait times were really awkward and getting our cheeseboard only moments before our meals really sucked.  We eventually could tell the waiter totally forgot to order it when we ordered our drinks. Sometimes it's hard to eat out as a former waiter, like I know I would have done a lot more to rectify that disappointing sitch...with the price points on this menu and an early 6:30 reservation we shouldn't feel rushed and like we're left waiting at the same time.  Def worth a visit, though it didn't quite charm me the way I had hoped it would.  Maybe next time I make it through the Pittsburgh rotation of awesome eats.

qDqxhji0Xo7oSapcDcvnyw.text: This was my first time here for lunch with a couple other coworkers on a Friday. Our server Riley was very attentive and did a great job. Complements to her. Upon entering it was very crowded and we were able to get a. Seat at the communal table which was just fine.  My two coworkers both had the turkey sandwich with gravy and loved it. They both said the turkey was very moist and not drive at all.  I had the brisket sandwich with onions on top. Sandwich also came with a Small salad. It was a good sandwich. I would definitely consider coming back to this place again.  I absolutely love the Decour in the buildout was absolutely phenomenal inside the space. My only complaint was the noise level was a little bit louder so if you're going there for a business meeting it may not be the best place just because of how loud it is.  I can definitely see coming to this place for drinks after work or even happy hour.

RNA1gP1CaJTovKF0t93YmA.text: The food is amazingly creative combined with finger licking good:) outstanding job here. The layout, atmosphere is laid back / classy, and the food and drinks follow it up for a perfect evening:)

iGAPLLNvZWZwTAXXCKQKLg.text: Excellent new option in downtown Pittsburgh.  Food and service were equally impressive.

TpaU6dYNBUvOu0roGxl8RQ.text: I really enjoyed a date night at The Commoner, but it was quite pricey. The cauliflower was recommended and at first I thought, "huh?" but ended up loving it! The food was really delicious, I just wish I would have had room for dessert! Can't wait to go back after a pay day!

QVbDGASXOrr3-_6ufloy1w.text: We went as a group of 13 with reservations and our table was waiting for us. The food was excellent. I had the steak and ale pie and the meat was tender and the "gravy" had a deep rich flavor. Highly recommend it. The place was LOUD however and almost impossible to carry on a conversation with anyone but the person sitting closest to you.   We went to have conversation over dinner and it was virtually impossible.

GVi3aFWkUKaBvyslpbgawQ.text: Innovative food, great drinks and awesome service. The Commoner Collins is amazing and if you are there for breakfast the Irish breakfast is very good as well. The whole ambiance combined with the menu & wait staff makes for a great experience. Ask for Ben if you go!

whRoesQahwbaWeGAv_VrQQ.text: Solid restaurant stop.  Had the onion burger and sticky toffee.  Everything from flavor to service was great.

3ZG9wvjnINFOTPV4iif6NA.text: My work team and I grabbed take out from the Commoner one night. It is definitely a great option for food but probably not the best takeout option. I had the burger which definitely didn't suffer, but some of the other meals didn't travel very well. I would still highly recommend!

ZYTTbwdhLkU5E1RDPGQPVg.text: Only been there once for brunch, but I think it's safe to say their food deserves at least 4 stars. Love the benedicts and liver pave.

X0r0_iHN0yeaiWP0T6KLkA.text: The one star is for the nice staff. Unfortunately it doesn't change the fact that 1. Waited 40 mins for my takeout order, 2. Confirmed foie gras is pate, but it's not, 3. Ask for no cilantro but still have it in my soup. 4. Promised pita bread with foie gras but got none. Completely disappointed!

lknCodHxA0rQ2YzXNof-0w.text: I brought my brother here for his birthday & came ready to try everything!!! The inside has a nice rustic retro kind of, but very nice, unique feel to it, Love the decor. Our server Jordan made excellent recommendations, & provided excellent service. He even had a candle in the AMAZING sticky bun cake dessert that we ordered, & sang a little birthday song. Our first round of drinks included the old fashion & a brumble something or other? I cant remember but it was a very good drink recommendation, it ended up being my favorite drink of the night For our second round we had a Manhattan & a pickled chili pepper martini. We went big for appetizers, everything sounded so good. Pesto crusted bone marrow, smoked beef tartare, liver mousse, French onion soup, oysters on a half shell, & braised pork cheek. The tartare was my favorite, but I'm biased as I LOVE tartare. The next best picks were the mousse, bone marrow & oysters. For our main course, we shared the Lamb Shank & crab mac & cheese. The lamb was so tender, every bite just melted. The crab mac & cheese seemed a shade too salted, even for having seafood in it, but it was STILL good. Believe it or not, me & my brother alone ate every single bite! I will absolutely be recommending this place!
